title: Rush live at the hollywood bowl 07-23-2007
description:
Rush
July 23rd, 2007
Hollywood Bowl
Hollywood, California

Video Source: 1 Sony DVM85 MiniDV HD Tape, 1 Sony DVM63 MiniDV HD Tape > Sony HDV-HC3 HD Camcorder > Firewire > HD Capture in Sony Vegas 6.0d
Video Recorded by RJPass

Audio Source: Schoeps MK41 > actives > NBox > Edirol R-09 @ 24bit/48kHz
Audio Recorded by Josephine

Alt Audio Source:  DSM 6EL > R-09 @ 48khz/24bit > Adobe Audition 2> 44.1khz/16bit Flattened peak at 650hz and level boost (not compressed)
Alt Audio Recorded by Bob S.


Video Rendered from 1440x1080i to 720x480p Widescreen
Motion Menu Design using Sony Vegas 6.0d, Adobe Photoshop CS3 and Adobe Encore CS3 in Widescreen
DVD Transcoded at 8mbps Constant Bit Rate

DVD1:

Limelight 
Digital Man 
Entre Nous 
Mission 
Freewill 
The Main Monkey Business 
The Larger Bowl 
Secret Touch 
Circumstances 
Between The Wheels 
Dreamline 

DVD2:

Far Cry *
Workin&#039; Them Angels 
Armor And Sword 
Spindrift 
The Way The Wind Blows **
Subdivisions 
Natural Science 
Witch Hunt 
Malignant Narcissism 
Drum Solo ***
Hope ***

DVD3:

Distant Early Warning 
The Spirit Of Radio 
Tom Sawyer 
One Little Victory 
A Passage to Bangkok 
YYZ ***

Filmer Notes:

* = Alt Audio used for Intro of song before Geddy Starts singing, then fades back to the main source.
** = Outro of Previous track and Intro of this track has no video, was doing a tape swap.
*** = Closeup&#039;s are present

What can i say about this show?  I love the way it turned out!!  It could have been a little better but hey, im just a quality snob.  I&#039;m sure you guys will enjoy it.  Designing the Motion menu&#039;s was probably the most fun!  There are a few times where the video was rough or i got something in the way of the lense but other than that, it&#039;s stable.  It was perched on one of the tables that the Hollywood Bowl so kindly provides to us to use to dine in the  Box Seats.  Shot right center from FOH it provides a good wide angle view with a vew closeups as listed above, and you will see people walking in front of the camera often because it&#039;s right on the aisle, i cant control that but it&#039;s still incredibly stable and very watchable.  There is also no video between Tom Sawyer and One Little Victory to save space on the tape.  Once we start trading blu-ray&#039;s, it will be released in a blu-ray format seeing as i did HD transfer of this show back to HD tapes to preserve the HD quality but for now, this is as close as you&#039;re going to get.  I hope you enjoy it!  -RJPass
